sen.j: 大原（おおはら/おはら）は、京都市左京区北東部の比叡山西麓高野川 (京都市)上流部に位置する小規模盆地の名称。
sen.e: Ohara (the kanji used is 大原 which is pronounced as O-o-ha-ra or O-ha-ra) is a name of small-scale basin located in the upstream region of Takano-gawa River (Kyoto City) at the western foot of Mt. Hiei in the northeastern part of Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.

Ohara (the kanji used is 大原 which is pronounced as O-o-ha-ra or O-ha-ra) is the name of a small-scale basin located in the upstream region of Takano-gawa River (Kyoto City) at the western foot of Mt. Hiei in the northeastern part of Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 古くは「おはら」と読まれ、小原とも表記された。
sen.e: The kanji "大原" was pronounced as 'O-ha-ra' in old times, and another kanji "小原" was also used.
The kanji "大原" was pronounced 'O-ha-ra' in olden times, and another kanji "小原" was also used.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The name '大原' was pronounced 'O-ha-ra' in ancient times and was also written as 小原.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: かつては山城国愛宕郡に属し、南隣の八瀬とセットで「八瀬大原」とも称された。
sen.e: Ohara used to belong to Otagi Gun, Yamashiro Province, and was also called 'Yase Ohara' in combination with Yase which was an adjoining region on the south side of Ohara.
Ohara used to belong to Otagi Gun, Yamashiro Province, and was also called 'Yase Ohara' in combination with Yase which was an adjoining region on the south side of Ohara.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Ohara used to belong to Otagi District, Yamashiro Province and was also called 'Yase Ohara' in combination with Yase which neighbored Ohara to its south.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: 平安京（京都）と若狭湾を結ぶ若狭街道の中継地点として栄えた。
sen.e: Ohara was flourished as a relay point on the Wakasa Kaido Road which connected between Heian-kyo (ancient Kyoto) and the Wakasa Bay.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳分の例外対処
sen.e: Ohara flourished as a relay point on the Wakasa Kaido Road which connected Heian-kyo (ancient Kyoto) and the Wakasa Bay.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Ohara flourished as a relay exchange point on the Wakasa Kaido Road which connected Heian-kyo (Kyoto) and Wakasa Bay.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: また延暦寺に近かったことから、勝林院・来迎院 (京都市左京区)・三千院・寂光院など多くの天台宗系寺院が建立された。
sen.e: Since Ohara was close to the Enryaku-ji Temple, many temples of Tendai sect such as Shorin-in Temple and Raigo-in Temple (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City), Sanzen-in Temple, Jakko-in Temple, etc. were built.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳分の例外対処
sen.e: Since Ohara was close to the Enryaku-ji Temple, many temples of Tendai sect such as Shorin-in Temple and Raigo-in Temple (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City), Sanzen-in Temple, Jakko-in Temple, etc. were built.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Since Ohara was close to the Enryaku-ji Temple, many temples of Tendai sect such as Shorin-in Temple and Raigo-in Temple (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City), Sanzen-in Temple, Jakko-in Temple, etc. were built.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、戦争・政争による京都からの脱出のルートとしても用いられ、出家・隠遁の地としても古くから知られていた。
sen.e: Ohara was also used as a place to escape from Kyoto due to wars and political strife, and also known as a place to enter into the priesthood or to retire from the world since olden times.
sen.cmt: 政争→political strife[http://www.eudict.com/?lang=jpkeng&word=政争]
sen.e: Ohara was also used as a place to escape from Kyoto due to wars and political strife, and was also known as a place to enter into the priesthood or to retire from the world since olden times.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Ohara was also used as an escape route from Kyoto in times of war and political strife, and since ancient times was also known as a place at which to enter the Buddhist priesthood or to retire from the society.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 惟喬親王や建礼門院をはじめ、大原三寂（常盤三寂）と称された寂念・寂超・寂然兄弟、藤原顕信・西行・鴨長明などの隠遁の地として知られている。
sen.e: Ohara has been known as a place where not only Imperial Prince Koretaka and Kenreimonin but also Jakunen, Jakucho and Jakuzen who were called three brothers of the Ohara no sanjaku (three brothers of the Tokiwa no sanjaku), FUJIWARA no Akinobu, SAIGYO, KAMO no Chomei, etc. retired from the world.

Ohara has been known as a place where not only Imperial Prince Koretaka and Kenreimonin but also Jakunen, Jakucho and Jakuzen who were called three brothers of the Ohara no sanjaku (three brothers of the Tokiwa no sanjaku), FUJIWARA no Akinobu, SAIGYO, KAMO no Chomei, etc. retired from the world.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Ohara is known as the place where individuals who included Imperial Prince Koretaka, Kenreimonin but also brothers of Jakunen, Jakucho and Jakuzen who were called the Ohara no Sanjaku (or Tokiwa no Sanjaku), FUJIWARA no Akinobu, Saigyo and KAMO no Chomei retired from the world.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。補足しました。

sen.j: 中世以後は薪炭の生産地として知られ、独自のいでたちをした大原女が京都まで薪炭を売り歩き、白川女・桂女と並び称された。
sen.e: In and after the medieval period, Ohara was known as a place of producing firewood and charcoal, and Oharame with a unique appearance walked to Kyoto to sell firewood and charcoal, and was admired equally to Shirakawame and Katsurame.

During and after the medieval period, Ohara was known as a place where firewood and charcoal were produce, and Oharame with a unique appearance walked to Kyoto to sell firewood and charcoal, and were equally admired by Shirakawame and Katsurame.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: After the middle ages, Ohara was known as a place where firewood and charcoal were produced, and Oharame (the women of Ohara), who were as highly regarded as Shirakawame (women from Kita-Shirakawa who sell flowers) and Katsurame (women from Katsura, Kyoto city), with their unique clothing would walk to Kyoto to sell this firewood and charcoal.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 後には柴漬や茶、麦粉などの特産でも知られるようになった。
sen.e: Afterward, Ohara also became known for special products such as Shibazuke (salted chopped pickled vegetables), tea and wheat flour.
Afterward, Ohara also became known for special products such as Shibazuke (salted chopped pickled vegetables), tea and wheat flour.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Ohara subsequently also became known for special products such as shibazuke (salted chopped pickled vegetables), tea and wheat flour.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 近世の大原郷は12の村から構成されていたが、1883年に中心部の8村が合併して「大原村」を名乗り、1889年の町村制制定の際に残り4村を合併して愛宕郡大原村となった。
sen.e: Ohara-go during the early-modern times consisted of twelve villages; however, in 1883, a village named 'Ohara-mura' was formed as a result of merging eight villages in the central part, and when the town and village system was established in 1889, Ohara-mura, Otagi-gun was formed as a result of merging remaining four villages.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳分の例外対処
sen.e: Ohara-go during the early-modern times consisted of twelve villages; however, in 1883, a village named 'Ohara-mura' was formed as a result of merging eight villages in the central part, and when the town and village system was established in 1889, Ohara-mura, Otagi-gun was formed as a result of merging the remaining four villages.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: During the early-modern period, Ohara-go Township consisted of 12 villages, but in 1883 the eight central villages merged to form the village of 'Ohara-mura,' and when the city-town-village system was enacted in 1889 the remaining four villages merged to form Ohara Village, Otagi District.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: その際、旧12の村はそのまま集落として引き継がれ、後に13番目の集落として古知谷が分離・成立した。
sen.e: At that time, formerly twelve villages remained as settlement, and thereafter, Kochidani was separated and formed as the thirteenth settlement.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳分の例外対処
sen.e: At that time, twelve former villages remained as settlements, and thereafter, Kochidani separated and formed the thirteenth settlement.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: At that time, the 12 former villages continued as settlements and Kochidani subsequently separated to form a 13th settlement.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: 1949年に大原村は京都市左京区に編入され、13の集落はそれぞれ「大原○○町」と呼ばれる小字となった。
sen.e: In 1949, Ohara-mura was merged into Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, and along with changing the administrative unit of settlement to koaza (small administrative unit (of a village)), thirteen settlements came to be called 'XXcho, Ohara,' respectively.
sen.cmt: 大原○○町→XXcho, Ohara[Webサイト用語検索内の「大原古知平町83」の表記"Kochidairacho 83, Ohara"の表記に合わせました。]
sen.e: In 1949, Ohara-mura merged into Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, and along with changing the administrative unit of settlement to koaza (small administrative unit of a village), thirteen settlements came to be called 'XXcho, Ohara,' respectively.
sen.cmt: grammar, punctuation
sen.e: In 1949, Ohara Village was incorporated into Kyoto City's Sakyo Ward, and the 13 settlements were each designated koaza (small administrative unit of a village) named 'Ohara XX-cho.'
